with the wounded D61okhov. 
The latter lay silent in the sleigh with closed eyes and did not answer a word to the ques- tions addressed to him. But on entering Mos- cow he suddenly came to and, lifting his head with an effort, took Rost6v, who was sitting be- side him, by the hand. Rost6v was struck by the totally altered and unexpectedly rapturous and tender expression on Ddlokhov's face. 
"Well? How do you feel?" he asked. 
"Bad! But it's not that, my friend "said D61- okhov with a gaspin
